page.title: 01Around Earl Stonham
page.content: The area consists of a major part of the parish of Earl Stonham and parts of Stonham Parva, Creeting St Peter, Creeting St Mary and Stowupland. The landscape is undulating, reaching 65 metres above sea level in th West, falling to a minor tributary of the River Deben in the South The soil is a fertile heavy clay, nearly all arable land and intensively cultivated producing wheat, barley, sugar beet, oilseed rape peas and beans. About 600 people live in the area, most in the scattered hamlets of Earl Stonham and about 200 in Stonham Parva which is concentrated on the Ipswich, Norwich Road. The largest single employer is a fruit packing establishment in Earl Stonham and a few people work on the local farms. The majority however,travel to work in Ipswich, Stowmarket or Needham Market.
